text: In this video, we will show you
a few ways to find diamonds in Minecraft.

We're going to show
you a few easy methods,
like caving and strip mining,
and then some advanced methods,
like crawl mining and using subtitles.

Use the clickable sections
below to skip to each method.
The first method is caving.
Caving is simply following
a naturally generated cave system
and mining any diamonds you find.

This next method is the classic
way of looking for diamonds.
You can look for a cave and start there
or simply just dig down from the surface.
Break two blocks and stand in the middle.
Then start breaking a block from each side
and make your way down.
If you press F3,

you will see that at the
top left of your screen,
it now shows your coordinates.
You'll need to keep digging down
until the Y is at level 12 or 11.

Those are the levels that
diamonds usually spawn in.

However, with part two of the
new 1.17 Minecraft update,

the levels where diamonds
spawn may change.

Once you've made your way
to either of those levels,

choose a direction
you'd like to go towards
and then start mining.
You can change your direction

and mine in multiple
tunnels to cover more areas.
Eventually you will run into diamonds.

Crawl mining is very
similar to strip mining.
The difference is that you save
more durability on your pickax

and the mining space
is smaller and faster.

To use this method, you will
need to place a trap door,
then stand next to it and close it

so that you're now in
a laid-down position.
Then you can start mining.

You can also find diamonds
by using subtitles.

Go to your game settings
and click on "Options."
Then click on "Music & Sounds."

At the bottom, you will notice
there's a subtitles option.
Turn them on.
After doing this,
a small window will appear
on the bottom right of your screen.
Subtitles show you the sounds of the game.

Arrows also point to where
noises are coming from.
To find diamonds, listen for lava.

Keep mining around until
you start to hear some lava,

and then go towards that
direction using the subtitles.

Diamonds sometimes tend
to spawn near lava.

If you find a lava pool
close to the levels
that diamonds usually spawn in,

you have a great chance
of coming across them.
Dig around the lava pool
and see if you can find any diamonds.
